Articles.Content:
So, here’s the big boy…Re-entry burn marks and no exhaust plume clipping into terrain. So the plume would adapt to the ground by getting wider or interacting and breaking up once touching an object. This could also work with parts by the plume going around or destroying the part. Another thing is no wheel clipping which means that the wheel does not ever go below the surface. Plus, Kerbal head clipping. Whenever the kerbal responds to the G-force, it moves in a direction away from the force. Sometimes, the Kerbal’s head clips though the glass or spacecraft and it is very immersion breaking. I also think that the camera transition, whenever you dock or undock, is too rigid. When this happens, the camera just jumps to the ship with no smooth motion there. In KSP 1 the smooth transition was present. Finally, UN-ALIVING THE KRAKEN! Who likes the Kraken. We get deformed spacecraft, the KSC in space, bendy rockets, wheels flipping under surface and sending your rover to an escape trajectory, and so much more. This is my list I got on hand. I wished for vapor cones, but I am incredibly happy that it was confirmed by the devs about a week ago. I can’t wait to see what KSP 2 turns into. 

Edited February 25, 2023 by CytauriKerbal

A few more after extensively playing...A nice transition of the exhaust plume as it throttles up (instead of it just jumping to full length) and vice versa for throttling down, performance improvements [also on terrain (man, it lags there)], no floating Kerbals above water or terrain, collisions with rocks in planetary rings, better scatter, planting flag on spacecraft bug fixed, and planetary textures with better resolution.

Option to make spaceships shiny in different colors.

 

Make Minmus minty green please!
